topics.body:
I'm about to let you all take a peak into my personal life for a second. It's late and I feel like -blogging- rambling.

Growing up, I was once pretty social. I got on well with other students. Then I got bullied. I never took bullying well and cried all the damn time. Suffice to say, it was embarrassing. As I reached high school, I had a mental barrier on my social skills. If I shut up, then nobody would feel the need to bully me and for a while it worked.
Then come college, I realised it was a bad idea. I had no idea how to talk to people at the time and would prefer to stay isolated while all the other kids grew up to become teenage fathers or go to university. I didn't think I would ever be that successful in any regard and would always be pathetic.

Now, I'm at university, I'm losing weight, I'm getting fit and I'm probably going to be the first of my close circle of friends to have a steady relationship if all goes well. And speaking of friends, that includes you guys.
This is going to come out of nowhere, but I am grateful for you all. I truly am.

Apologies if that was random. Like I said, I needed a ramble.
topics.author: 515ddf93a4c72d8a1f000d57
